FuzzyExpression 
 public FuzzyExpression(LinguisticVariable lVariable,
                        String mVariable,
                        Vector hVector,
                        String textRepresentation)
Constructor. Create an fuzzy expression "something is hedge, hedge, ... something". For example, if expression is "temperature is not very high" then lVariable = temperature, mVariable = normal, hVector = not, very, textRepresentation = temperature is not very high. This class is a service class for FuzzyRule and should not be used otherwise.

Parameters:
lv - engine.LinguisticVariable Lingustic variable
mf - java.lang.String Membership function
hVector - java.util.Vector Vector containing all the hedges
textRepresentation - java.lang.String Text representation of this expression

evaluateExpression 
 public double evaluateExpression() throws EvaluationException
Evaluate this fuzzy expression, compute and store result.

Returns:
Result of evaluation
Throws: RulesParsingException
This exception is thrown if an error occurs during evaluation
executeExpression 
 public double executeExpression(double value,
                                 String label) throws EvaluationException
Execute this fuzzy expression with the given value and label.

Parameters:
value - Double result of the last fired expression.
label - String label of this rule.
Throws: RulesParsingException
This exception is thrown if an error occurs during evaluation.
getTextExpression 
 public String getTextExpression()
Return text representation of this expression.

Returns:
java.lang.String
